author: dmitriishmatko
content: We are rebasing Teku PeerDAS on the Pectra btw, sir, it's huge in our enterprise, doing it for more than a week and still don't see a finish line

author: jtraglia
content:
We have a spec PR which does this. But we're waiting to merge it until pectra-devnet-4 is stable.
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3893

author: barnabasbusa
content: I think generally the longer we wait the harder itâ€™s gonna get. So ideally in the next devnet we already use pectra base

author: jtraglia
content: How do clients feel about this? Should we target this for the next specs release?

author: jtraglia
content: We can chat about it tomorrow at ACDC. If so, we can merge that PR & make a release next week.

author: barnabasbusa
content: my main worry is that peerdas is so fragile, I just donâ€™t wanna increase the complexity for no good reason. But the further the branches will go, the harder the rebase gonna get. - see verkle geth rebase for example.

author: dmitriishmatko
content: From my understanding CL clients are pretty stable in pectra already, there are more issues on EL side we are not going to interact with. Spec is still changing, yes, but it's ok, upstreaming week changes will be easy after merging 6 month of changes.

author: agnxsh
content: so for us, we're not planning to go for a direct rebase, because it would be insanely difficult for us to track features/fixes, given that we also have a fake deneb fork schedule, we are putting peerdas components into pectra one by one, every functional piece at a time, hence, that would take us no less than a month.

author: agnxsh
content: realistically

author: agnxsh
content: same as teku, i am parallely working on having the peerdas components into pectra as we speak, and to be honest, it is quite alot to ship.
